boardgame.name: Napoleon: The Waterloo Campaign Game
Napoleon: The Waterloo Campaign, 1815
boardgame.description: On June 18, 1815, one of the most decisive battles in military history was fought in Belgian fields twenty miles southeast of Brussels. Within a short 100 days, Napoleon, former emperor of France, had returned from exile on the island of Elba, again seized power, quickly assembled an army, and marched to defeat the dispersed British and Prussian armies now preparing to invade France._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;Napoleon invaded Belgium on June 15th, defeated the Prussians at the Battle of Ligny on the 16th and after a day of pursuit, faced the British and Dutch army commanded by Wellington. Aided by superb defensive tactics and the timely arrival of Prussian reinforcements, Wellington defeated the French in the great Battle of Waterloo, ending forever the military ambitions of the great Napoleon._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;Highlights:_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt; Mapboard which is a color map of southern Belgium. _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt; Wooden Blocks as counters provide step-reduction and fog of war with no muss or fuss _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt; Two or three player game - Napoleon can be played by two or three players. With three, the allied side has two players, one British and one Prussian, and some special rules apply. _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt; Note that there are essentially three different versions of the game which means that the rules are somewhat different. Key Differences in the various editions:_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt; 1st and 2nd edition had 48 blocks--shorter (60+ min.) play time -- vs.-- 3rd edition has 84 blocks--more accurate division level_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt; 3rd edition had Bl_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;uuml;cher, Napoleon, and Wellington leader blocks that give slight combat and movement bonuses. Although units have increased nearly two fold, the 3rd edition map remains same size, leading to overcrowding._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt; 4th edition has 56 blocks and a larger map - play time is usually 90 minutes or less._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt; _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;

listing.notes: Minor scuffing to box, maps and pieces all present and in excellent shape. This is the Avalon Hill edition.
Box cover looks like new. Contents are in great shape. This is the 1977 Avalon Hill version, and it has imprinted counters.

This is the classic Avalon Hill version of Napoleon, copyright 1977. Game is complete (48 wooden game pieces, 4 dice, 2 battle cards, rules _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp; historical notes)... box has a couple of taped corners, ordinary wear on a nearly 30 year old game. Game pieces are like new with unit designations and strength factors imprinted on the wood. Great game to add to your collection! $20 plus $8 shipping
in excellent condition, AH version in silver box

Excellent condition. Columbia Games 1st edition with 82 blocks. Includes rules for 1st edition plus color printout of 3.2 edition rules. Both rules note there should be 82 blocks. While the blocks and gameboard are in fine condition, the box was worn so I bought a new box from Columbia Games parts department. This box notes 84 blocks. I am not sure if that is atypo or Columbia Games felt the need to add 2 more blocks.

Napoleon: The Waterloo Campaign Game 1977 Edition - Avalon Hill Box (corners are worn; otherwise good and sturdy) Contents: All counters/blocks (very good condition; there are 48 in this edition, not 84 like in the later editions) Rule Book (yellowed in places) Mapboard (good condition) 2 Battle Cards (yellowed edges) 4 6-sided Dice
Columbia Games; Shrinkwrap removed, otherwise in new condition. Instructions dated 1994. Other inserts show ver 3.1 .

The box has moderate corner wear on three corners, and one is crunched. It was taped sometime ago. In addition there is a stain on the inside of the box where the box was crunched. The contents of the game itself are in excellent condition with vibrant colors. This is copyright 1977 from Avalon Hill, therefore I’m not positive it should be listed in this section, but I couldn’t find a better fit. The box does not have the crest around the “N” in the top left corner as does the picture shown above. I will ship the game anywhere in the continental U.S. for $12 and anywhere else in the world for $2 over shipping cost. (Knights of the Dinner Table), I.Q. Derby, High Ground (new and used), Knights, Knights of Charlemagne, Life (in Monstropolis), Longstreet’s Assault, Lord of the Fries, Lord of the Rings – The Duel, Mamma Mia, Manhattan, Modern Art, My Word! (regular and Junior), Name Burst, Napoleon, Origins of World War II, Partyzone “Spy Ring”, Phase 10, Pirates (the constructible strategy game), Portable Adventures, Power Lunch, Qwitch, Rack-O, Read My Lips (Kid!), Red Empire, Scotland Yard, Seafarers of Catan 5-6 Player Expansion, Settlers of Catan Card Game, Skip-Bo, Solarquest, Space Beans, Stage II, Stock Market Game (AH – 1970), Strat-O-Matic Pro Basketball, Survival (double game with the Barbarian), Talk Show, Trailer Park Gods, Trivial Pursuit (base game and Baby Boomer edition), True Colors, Win Place and Show Zobmondo!! and Zomax.

Avalon Hill edition. All the blocks had sticky residue on the back - don_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;t ask me why. I cleaned them, but I cannot guarantee that they are ABSOLUTELY clean. Certainly if any are still a bit sticky they are cleanable. Also, one of the battle sheets has brown images of blocks over a large part of it - I suppose the blocks were left on it for a long time and discolored the paper. However, all the information can be seen, so it is still usable. Otherwise the game is in good shape. An Avalon Hill catalog is included.

AH Edition. Box and rules a bit weathered, but otherwise like new. Includes a dye-sublimation printed color enlarged copy of the battle map (you can see it on the right of the photo). Include le regole in italiano.

This is the Columbia Games version! All games are new and in their original wrapping. We offer only goods that we have in stock. We ship worldwide – please ask for a quote about exact shipping costs (rest assured that we always try to keep them as low as possible). Payment may be made by Paypal or bank transfer in advance. For orders above €50 we grant a discount of €4 on shipping costs. If you have any questions, feel free to send us an email (laden@gamers-hq.de), give us a call (+49 30 79706126) or visit our homepage (gamers-hq.de) Innerhalb Deutschlands gilt: Die Versandkosten betragen 4,00 € . Ab einem Bestellwert von 50,00 € fallen keine Versandkosten an! Bezahlt werden kann per paypal, Vorauskasse, Bankeinzug oder direkt bei uns im Laden (wenn ihr aus Berlin kommt). Wenn ihr noch irgendwelche Fragen habt, ruft uns an (030 79706126), schickt uns ne Mail (laden@gamers-hq.de) oder besucht unsere Homepage (gamers-hq.de). Und hier noch die übliche, rechtliche Belehrung: Sie können ohne Angabe von Gründen durch Erklärung per Fax, E-Mail oder einfaches Briefschreiben oder durch Rücksendung unserer Waren eine Bestellung widerrufen. Für die Absendung der Widerrufserklärung oder unserer Waren ist eine Widerrufsfrist von zwei Wochen einzuhalten, die mit Eingang unserer Lieferung bei Ihnen beginnt.
Unsere Ware ist sofort nach der fristgerechten Ausübung des Widerrufsrechts auf unsere Kosten und Gefahr an uns zurückzusenden, wenn der Widerruf nicht bereits durch Rücksendung ausgeübt wurde. Achten Sie bitte bei der Rücksendung darauf, dass Sie eine geeignete Verpackung benutzen, vorzugsweise die Originalverpackung. Ausnahmsweise sind die Kosten der Rücksendung von Ihnen zu tragen, wenn der Rechnungswert unserer Ware nicht mehr als Euro 20,00 beträgt. In keinem Fall haben Sie die Kosten der Rücksendung zu tragen, wenn die von uns gelieferte Ware nicht der bestellten Ware entspricht. Sollten Sie bereits den Kaufpreis für die Ware bezahlt haben, werden wir diesen nach einem Widerruf unverzüglich zurückerstatten. Wenn Sie unsere Ware nach dem Widerruf ganz oder teilweise nicht oder nur in verschlechtertem Zustand zurücksenden, sind Sie uns gesetzlich zu Wertersatz verpflichtet. Das gilt nicht, soweit Sie unsere Ware lediglich so geprüft haben, wie Sie es z.B. im Ladengeschäft hätten tun können. Jede darüber hinausgehende Nutzung der Ware berechtigt uns jedoch zu Ersatzansprüchen, die unter Umständen die Höhe des Kaufpreises erreichen können. Sollten Sie also einen Widerruf in Betracht ziehen, beschränken Sie sich möglichst auf eine optische Prüfung und nehmen Sie die Ware nicht regulär in Gebrauch.
